data.title: pixelPositionForScreenPosition intermittently throws
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

`pixelPositionForScreenPosition()` intermittently throws. Full error reported [here](https://github.com/forgecrafted/rulerz/issues/25), excerpt is:

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'NaN' of undefined
    at TextEditorComponent.renderedScreenLineForRow (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:905:31)
    at TextEditorComponent.pixelLeftForRowAndColumn (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:2229:29)
    at TextEditorComponent.pixelPositionForScreenPosition (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:187:40)
    at HTMLElement.pixelPositionForScreenPosition (/Applications/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-element.js:243:32)
    at HTMLElement.RulerView.update (/packages/rulerz/lib/ruler-view.coffee:61:23)
```

This error is intermittently thrown. I've wrapped it in a `try` / `catch` and if I retry a second time inside a `setTimeout(fn)` then I've never been able to get it to throw twice in my testing.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Install rulerz plugin 0.4.3
* Repeatedly open new split screens

Apologies, I know that's not a very good reproduction, this is my first foray into atom hacking so I'm not sure how to produce a smaller reproduction yet.

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]

It always happens on application start, but then intermittently on new pane creation.

### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.19.7
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0
```

```
apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.10
git 2.10.2
```

### Additional Information

I realise this is a low quality bug report, apologies. I'm open to any feedback on how I might be able to improve it.

data.title: Editor crash while debugging after doing a step over
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Atom crashes once I stop on a break point and click step over.

![virtualbox_linux mint 18 2_19_09_2017_12_17_23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24731903/30585532-d78cee64-9d35-11e7-861c-fd7594527674.png)

This happened while trying to debug https://github.com/atom/symbols-view/pull/229.

Might be dependent on external factors such as the operating system and VirtualBox to reproduce this.

I'm seeing this in dmesg:
```
[ 1284.229480] traps: atom[4986] trap invalid opcode ip:1816b25 sp:7ffcbaabe390 error:0
[ 1284.229484]  in atom[400000+49ce000]
```

Disassembly: (Can't tell what function that is, binary is stripped)
```
 1816b12:       e8 89 fc 51 00          callq  1d367a0 <_ZSt9make_heapIN9__gnu_cxx17__normal_iteratorIPiSt6vectorIiSaIiEEEEEvT_S7_@@Base+0x6430>
 1816b17:       48 83 c4 50             add    $0x50,%rsp
 1816b1b:       e9 6e fd ff ff          jmpq   181688e <_ZSt22__final_insertion_sortIPiEvT_S1_@@Base+0x9934e>
 1816b20:       e8 9b 42 d8 fe          callq  59adc0 <__stack_chk_fail@plt>
 1816b25:       0f 0b                   ud2    
 1816b27:       90                      nop
 1816b28:       90                      nop
 1816b29:       90                      nop
 1816b2a:       90                      nop
```

Sadly Atom doesn't give me any more info on how to collect additional information about this.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run Package Specs on https://github.com/atom/symbols-view/pull/229.
2. Open the Dev Tools and set a breakpoint on `symbols-view.js:193`.
3. Reload Specs.
4. Press Step Over.
5. Crash ☹️.

**Expected behavior:** Step over.

**Actual behavior:** Editor Crash.

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions
```
Linux 18.2 Cinnamon x64 (Ubuntu 16.04 Based) Running in VirtualBox 5.1.28 under Windows 10.0.15063 x64

Atom    : 1.20.0
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.12
git 2.14.1
```

data.title: How to uninstall atom in osx
data.body:
Hi, I want to uninstall atom in mac,  I installed it from official site https://atom.io/, but I can't find a way to completely remove it, looks like it is a malicious software.
I have tried many ways ,like 
https://discuss.atom.io/t/how-to-completely-uninstall-atom-for-mac/9084

I know it's not a good place to answer this question, but I think it's better in doc atom should mention how to uninstall it, it has wasted others a lot of time.

data.title: restore unsaved documents on a restart
data.body:
I'm currently using TextWrangler (OSX only I think) and 1 neat feature I frequently used used an unsaved documents as my scratchpad. I just dump things there and when I restart my machine and open it up again, the stuff are still there.

Is there a way to get similar feature in atom? I've looked at preferences and can't see anything that will work. I did see "Restore previous windows on restart" but it seems to only work for saved documents.

Thanks

data.title: Soft wrap flickering when very close to needing a vertical scrollbar
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

It seems that when the editor height is very close to needing a vertical scrollbar, soft-wrapped lines will rapidly flicker.  Possibly the vertical scrollbar is showing up for a fraction of a second before realizing it's not needed and hiding again.  On occasion, the cursor is also rendered incorrectly.  In the GIF, it is incorrectly appearing as a blue block below the line where the cursor actually is.

### Steps to Reproduce

This might be difficult to repro because on my screen there's only two pixels before the scrollbar is required.

1. Have a file with soft-wrapped lines that _almost_ reaches the threshold necessary for vertical scrollbars to appear
2. Move your cursor around the file, make some random selections, etc.

**Expected behavior:** Editor contents to stay static

**Actual behavior:** Soft-wrapped lines jump around as the scrollbar appearance is constantly recalculated

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

![uh](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2766036/30564290-d83a26cc-9cc4-11e7-8f96-ac8db91fe700.gif)

### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.22.0-dev-b269b2086
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0
```

If it's helpful, here's the contents of the file I was working on: https://gist.github.com/50Wliu/6d516fd9b32c1191303a5ac64ff39fe7

/cc: @nathansobo @ungb

data.title: Too many Atom Helper processes cause the computer to become unresponsive. It needs to be restarted
data.body:
### Description

Currently starting Atom makes my computer become completely unresponsive. The spinning wheel of death appears and it stops spinning in less than 1 minute. I cannot even move the mouse. 
I see that memory usage on the machine quickly climb.  I do not even have time to check in the activity monitor what is the memory consumption for Atom is. The graph does not have time to update but the text value show that all the memory is used. Kernel memory gets to 9GB (I have 16G on my MacBook). I need to restart holding the power button down. Since MacOS restarts the programs that were opened before shut down, I got stuck. I was able to overcome the problem by quickly shut down Atom after login. 

I wonder why the OS does not detect the problem and does something about it.

If I run Atom with `atom --safe` I do not have problems.
I am going to selectively disable plugins to find where the problem is.

But, whatever the problem is I think Atom should not become a problem for the whole system. 

### Versions

```
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.20.0
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

$ apm --version
apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.10
git 2.11.0
```

### Additional Information

This is the list of my packages:

```
Community Packages (31) 
├── atom-format-lua@0.1.5
├── atom-jade@0.3.0
├── autocomplete-js-import@1.4.0

├── language-marko@2.9.4
├── linter

├── linter-htmlhint@1.3.3

└── tree-view-copy-relative-path@1.2.0
```

data.title: Allow atom:// urls to be opened from the command line
data.body:
### Requirements

* All new code requires tests to ensure against regressions

I would love some guidance on how to write an automated test for this.

### Description of the Change

Some Atom extensions (like Nuclide) have functionality that can only be
triggered by open-url events, which only work on Mac OS.  With this
change, `atom://` URLs can be passed on the command-line, and they will
opened with the normal openUrl method on all platforms.

This change doesn't set Atom up as the default handler for atom:// urls.
That will require some platform-specific changes.


### Alternate Designs

I considered making a separate option for passing urls (--open-url), but this seems more convenient.

### Why Should This Be In Core?

Very simple change.  Brings the "open-url" interface to all platforms.

### Benefits

Windows and Linux users can easily simulate "open-url" events.

### Possible Drawbacks

Can't use the atom command line to open a file whose name starts with `atom://`, though you can still use `./atom://foo` or just `atom:/foo`.

data.title: Notify when deserializing project state for missing directories
data.body:
When deserializing a serialized `Project` state that references one or more root directories that no longer exist, show an error notification.

When deserializing an _unmodified_ buffer that is no longer accessible for any reason, silently skip that buffer.

When deserializing a _modified_ buffer that is no longer accessible, deserialize the buffer. Eventually we might want to decorate the editor with a banner warning that the underlying file no longer exists.

Fixes #13325.

data.title: "The repository for X:\ is not open in Atom." Git Unstaged Changes Tab Error
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Clicking to view unstaged changes in the git panel just opens a blank window with the error "This repository for D:\ is not open in Atom", this happens for every project I've tried it on.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open project in Atom
2. Expand git panel, click on unstaged change
3. The "Unstaged Changes" tab only says "The repository for D:\ is not open in Atom.", or with C:\ instead of D:\.

**Expected behavior:** Show file changes. This used to work but recently broke.

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions

Atom    : 1.20.0
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 3.6.0
git 2.12.1.windows.1
visual studio

Running Windows 10 1073

### Additional Information

Atom correctly knows which files have been changed and it shows the right colours for changed/removed/new lines too.

### Description

Open file should just open file chosen and not load folders in tree view

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Start atom.
2. Open file (File -> Open File...) that resides in a folder that has sub folders.

**Expected behavior:**

Open file chosen for opening and nothing else.

**Actual behavior:**

Opens file and loads folder and sub folders in tree view.

**Reproduces how often:**

Always - 100%.

### Versions

1.20.0

data.title: When starting as a snap, it's impossible to drop back into the shell
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

When using the deb package on Ubuntu 16.04 to start atom in a project folder by running `atom .`, i can drop back into the terminal to continue working in the directory. This is not possible using the snap package, which can break the work-flow for developers who use the terminal a lot.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Use Ubuntu 16.04
2. Run `sudo snap install atom`
3. Navigate to your project folder
4. Run `atom .`

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

Atom starts in the project folder and i can continue to use the terminal window to work with `git` and other command line tools.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

Atom starts in the project folder and outputs debugging information in the terminal. It's impossible to use the same terminal window to continue working.

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]

100%

### Versions

- Atom: 1.20.0
- Electron: 1.6.9
- Chrome: 56.0.2924.87
- Node: 7.4.0

- Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS

### Additional Information

The behavior only occurs when using the snap package.

data.title: Atom launchs as browser window, not as redactor.
data.body:
Hi, i have a little broblem. I installed Atom from atom.io, and the redactor is launching as browser window. Whats problem?
![default](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17050686/30520681-a3b25d98-9bbb-11e7-868c-9a1ddcb0ca90.png)

data.title: coffeescript syntax highlighting broke
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Since a few days coffeescript syntax highlighting broke in that it renders comments as code and regexes as comments and removes it alltogether in other parts.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. unknown

**Expected behavior:** old behaviour - correct syntax highlighting

**Actual behavior:** ![screenshot](https://i.imgur.com/eNflOex.png)

**Reproduces how often:** always for longer files

### Versions

```
>atom -v
Atom    : 1.20.0
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

>apm -v
apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.13
git 2.8.1.windows.1
visual studio 2015

>coffee -v
CoffeeScript version 2.0.0-beta5

>systeminfo
Microsoft Windows 7 Professional
6.1.7601 Service Pack 1 Build 7601
```

### Additional Information

Had the idea it might be due to having coffeescript@2.0.0-beta5 installed which preserves single line comments but switching back to an older version and restarting atom didn't fix it. Having keywords in comments changes the outcome but it's broken either way.

data.title: cmd-g as goto line
data.body:
I'm on mac. I would like to set cmd-g as goto line.
I've put this in keymap.cson

'.platform-darwin, .platform-win32, .platform-linux':
  'cmd-g': 'go-to-line:toggle'
'.platform-darwin atom-text-editor':
  'f3': 'find-and-replace:find-next'

F3 works as find, cmd-g is still set to try to find strings. ctrl-g is goto line as default. I really would like cmd-g work as ctrl-g.
This is on mac with atom 1.20.
Also I really love this editor, thanks for making it!

data.title: :memo: Fix cursor name letter casing
data.body:
### Description of the Change

The docs currently say `Cursor` instead of `cursor`, just a quick fix there.

As discussed with @50Wliu on slack

data.title: DOMException: Failed to execute 'transaction' on 'IDBDatabase'
data.body:
I just installed Atom on a Win 7 machine. And basic functionality is broken for me. For instance, when I try to open a file nothing happens. I use the menu bar at the top and click on 'open file' and select a file - but then nothing happens. Same thing with clicking on 'settings' in the file menu. I tried booting Atom into safe mode and it still happens.

I opened the dev tool and each time I make a click that results in nothing an error appears. This is it:

Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Failed to execute 'transaction' on 'IDBDatabase': The database connection is closing.
    at Promise (C:\Users\andrewd\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.20.0\resources\app\src\state-store.js:62:32)
    at dbPromise.then (C:\Users\andrewd\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.20.0\resources\app\src\state-store.js:61:20)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12276420/30504314-e1ba0036-9a22-11e7-80af-18c8d0921d1a.png)


I'm not sure what is going on or what other info is needed here to help debug. Thoughts? Thanks.
-Andrew

data.title: Failed to load XYZ - try again later.
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * [x] Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * [x] Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * [x] Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * [x] Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * [x] Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

I'm behind a corporate firewall and using this settings inside `.atom/.apmrc` file:

```
proxy=http://user:password@host:port/
https-proxy=http://user:password@host:port/
strict-ssl=false
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Set up a proxy with self-signed certificate
2. Install clean version of latest atom
3. Go to "Install +" setting and click on any community package

**Expected behavior:**

View package description

**Actual behavior:**

Getting error: `Failed to load XYZ - try again later.`

**Reproduces how often:**

Every community package

### Versions

`atom --version`

```
Atom    : 1.20.0
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0
```

`apm --version`

```
apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.13
git 2.14.1.windows.1
```

`cmd /K ver`

```
Microsoft Windows [Version 6.1.7601]
```

### Additional Information

If I hit `CTRL+SHIFT+F5` on package description page, info message appears: `Loading XYZ...`
and then I get package description.

After I loaded it this way, I also get description of this package after restarting Atom

Also in Developers tools pane inside Network tab when I click on package in packag list I can't see any activity, it appears only when I hit refresh window keybinding

data.title: Add Project Folder Keyboard Shortcut Misbehaving
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [ ] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Using Atom on Windows 10, the Add Project Folder keyboard shortcut (Ctrl+Shift+A) does not respond to the first use of the shortcut, but will respond to the second use.  Once a project folder has been added via this method any other action taken afterward will prompt it to trigger once again, causing a major annoyance.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom
2. Use the Add Project Folder keyboard shortcut once (Ctrl+Shift+A).
3. Open the Command Palette with a keyboard shortcut, Ctrl+Shift+P.

**Expected behavior:** The Add Project Folder dialog window should appear after the first instance of the keyboard shortcut, but it does not until the Command Palette keyboard shortcut is triggered.

**Actual behavior:** Add Project Folder dialog window only appears after another keyboard shortcut is used.

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions

Atom    : 1.20.0
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.13
git 2.14.1
visual studio 2015

### Additional Information

I always run Atom in full-screen mode.  Doesn't seem to make a difference, but thought it might be helpful.
